title: InterContinental hit by Hong Kong protests
text:
Civil unrest in Hong Kong has cost InterContinental Hotels about $5m (£3.9m) in lost income.

The Holiday Inn and Crowne Plaza owner also bemoaned weaker business bookings on the Chinese mainland for a worse than expected slide in sales.

Revenue per available room, a key metric in the hotels industry known as RevPAR, fell 0.8pc in the three months to September, InterContinental said on Friday.

A softening in US markets also hit sales.

Chief executive Keith Barr said: “Despite the weaker RevPAR environment, and the challenges some of our markets are currently experiencing, we remain confident in our financial outcome for the rest of the year.”
